Amaro—literally bitter— is a traditional herbal liquore. Bitterness is an essential, revered delight to the Italian palate, and it holds a special place at the end of a meal. Each amaro follows its own unique, proprietary recipe that adheres to tradition and local ingredients. A laundry list of ingredients, often secret, is macerated in neutral spirit prior to distillation. Alcohol varies widely (typically from 15–40%), as does flavor, which ranges from bittersweet to sharply astringent
Bittersweet: a painless introduction
Not for the faint of heart
Bracingly bitter for the initiated

Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, You can enjoy the flavors of the Northwest shaken and strained in a Martini Shell. Vanilla Vodka, Hazelnut Liqueur , Kahlua and chilled double strength Coffee. Served up with a float of Fresh Whipped Cream. Almost too good to be true

First introduced to the United States at the 1964 World's Fair, Sangria is a fruity concoction of Fruit, Brandy and Wine. Jake's offers a red version made with cranberries and red wine as well as a refreshing basil peach sangria made with white wine
We puree Blueberries, Raspberries and Marionberries, add Vodka then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell. A cocktail with Anti-Oxidants
Italian Lemoncello Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice and Pomegranate Puree are hand shaken and topped with Sparkling Wine

Complex flavors, yet ultra refreshing. We muddle Fresh Basil, White Grapes and Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice. Then we add Vodka, Ginger Ale and Angostura Bitters. Shaken and served over ice. One taste and you'll see this cocktail lives up to its name

The West Coast's king of sour-style cocktails. Disputably invented at Henry Africa's in San Francisco, this drink strikes a perfect balance between vodka, orange liqueur, fresh lemon juice and a touch of sugar. Served up with a superfine sugar rim

name.en: Angry Orchard Apple Or Wyder's Dry Pear Hard Cider

description.en: There are many theories of origin regarding this incredibly popular cocktail. Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish we've been satisfying guests with our classic rendition for almost 40 years. Sauza Gold Tequila, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice , and a touch of sweetness are given a Jake's Famous shake and served on the rocks with salt

Recipes for this classic cocktail have been in print since the 1860s. Handcrafted with Bourbon, Fresh Squeezed Orange and Lemon Juice, a kiss of sweetness and garnished with an Orange and a Cherry. Sip a bit of history in our historic bar

The recipe for the Tom Collins first appeared in the 1876 edition of Jerry Thomas's "The Bartender's Guide". Enjoy our fresh juice version with your choice of Vodka, Gin (Tom Collins) or Bourbon (John Collins)

Originally made popular in cafes of Paris in the 1920s, this cocktail consists of Brandy, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon and Orange Juices then shaken to perfection and served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell...Santé
A contemporary classic, Vodka shaken with Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice and a splash of Cranberry

The King of all coffee cocktails. A proud mix of 151 Rum, Orange Liqueur and Kahlua is set on fire, dusted with Nutmeg and Cinnamon, filled with hot Coffee and extinguished with cold Whipped Cream. Enjoy the show!

We saved the best for last. Jake's Famous Crawfish made this classic a staple of the Portland cocktail scene before there was a Portland cocktail scene. We keep it traditional with Tullamore Dew Irish Whiskey, Steaming Hot Coffee, one Sugar Cube and a float of Bubbly Whipped Cream. This cocktail makes every day St. Patrick's Day!

An exotic blend of Sauza gold tequila, orange liqueur, mango puree, fresh squeezed orange & lime juice with muddled fresh jalapeno, and a dash of grenadine for color. Shaken Vigorously and served on the rocks with a salted rim

We transplanted this tasty cocktail from the heart of Savannah to Portland because it was so darn refreshing. We muddle fragrant mint leaves, fresh lemon juice and a dash of simple syrup. Add a generous pour of Absolut Apeach Vodka, fill with fresh brewed iced tea, then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served over ice
A delicious mix of Vodka, fresh squeezed lemon, orange, cherry puree with a touch of sweet. Hand shaken to perfection, over ice with a splash of club soda

With a colorful history that dates back to the pirates of the 1500's, its medicinal use in the 1800s, then to the exotic adventures of Ernest Hemmingway, and now to you here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, the Mojito is the perfect summer cocktail. Choose from the classic White Rum recipe or one of our exotic fruit flavored versions, Blueberry, Mango, Pomegranate, or Peach. Guaranteed to satisfy your taste buds

Amaro—literally bitter— is a traditional herbal liquore. Bitterness is an essential, revered delight to the Italian palate, and it holds a special place at the end of a meal. Each amaro follows its own unique, proprietary recipe that adheres to tradition and local ingredients. A laundry list of ingredients, often secret, is macerated in neutral spirit prior to distillation. Alcohol varies widely (typically from 15–40%), as does flavor, which ranges from bittersweet to sharply astringent
Bittersweet: a painless introduction
Not for the faint of heart
Bracingly bitter for the initiated

Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, You can enjoy the flavors of the Northwest shaken and strained in a Martini Shell. Vanilla Vodka, Hazelnut Liqueur , Kahlua and chilled double strength Coffee. Served up with a float of Fresh Whipped Cream. Almost too good to be true

First introduced to the United States at the 1964 World's Fair, Sangria is a fruity concoction of Fruit, Brandy and Wine. Jake's offers a red version made with cranberries and red wine as well as a refreshing basil peach sangria made with white wine
We puree Blueberries, Raspberries and Marionberries, add Vodka then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell. A cocktail with Anti-Oxidants
Italian Lemoncello Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice and Pomegranate Puree are hand shaken and topped with Sparkling Wine

Complex flavors, yet ultra refreshing. We muddle Fresh Basil, White Grapes and Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice. Then we add Vodka, Ginger Ale and Angostura Bitters. Shaken and served over ice. One taste and you'll see this cocktail lives up to its name

The West Coast's king of sour-style cocktails. Disputably invented at Henry Africa's in San Francisco, this drink strikes a perfect balance between vodka, orange liqueur, fresh lemon juice and a touch of sugar. Served up with a superfine sugar rim

name.en: Angry Orchard Apple Or Wyder's Dry Pear Hard Cider

description.en: There are many theories of origin regarding this incredibly popular cocktail. Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish we've been satisfying guests with our classic rendition for almost 40 years. Sauza Gold Tequila, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice , and a touch of sweetness are given a Jake's Famous shake and served on the rocks with salt

Recipes for this classic cocktail have been in print since the 1860s. Handcrafted with Bourbon, Fresh Squeezed Orange and Lemon Juice, a kiss of sweetness and garnished with an Orange and a Cherry. Sip a bit of history in our historic bar

The recipe for the Tom Collins first appeared in the 1876 edition of Jerry Thomas's "The Bartender's Guide". Enjoy our fresh juice version with your choice of Vodka, Gin (Tom Collins) or Bourbon (John Collins)

Originally made popular in cafes of Paris in the 1920s, this cocktail consists of Brandy, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon and Orange Juices then shaken to perfection and served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell...Santé
A contemporary classic, Vodka shaken with Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice and a splash of Cranberry

The King of all coffee cocktails. A proud mix of 151 Rum, Orange Liqueur and Kahlua is set on fire, dusted with Nutmeg and Cinnamon, filled with hot Coffee and extinguished with cold Whipped Cream. Enjoy the show!

We saved the best for last. Jake's Famous Crawfish made this classic a staple of the Portland cocktail scene before there was a Portland cocktail scene. We keep it traditional with Tullamore Dew Irish Whiskey, Steaming Hot Coffee, one Sugar Cube and a float of Bubbly Whipped Cream. This cocktail makes every day St. Patrick's Day!

An exotic blend of Sauza gold tequila, orange liqueur, mango puree, fresh squeezed orange & lime juice with muddled fresh jalapeno, and a dash of grenadine for color. Shaken Vigorously and served on the rocks with a salted rim

We transplanted this tasty cocktail from the heart of Savannah to Portland because it was so darn refreshing. We muddle fragrant mint leaves, fresh lemon juice and a dash of simple syrup. Add a generous pour of Absolut Apeach Vodka, fill with fresh brewed iced tea, then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served over ice
A delicious mix of Vodka, fresh squeezed lemon, orange, cherry puree with a touch of sweet. Hand shaken to perfection, over ice with a splash of club soda

With a colorful history that dates back to the pirates of the 1500's, its medicinal use in the 1800s, then to the exotic adventures of Ernest Hemmingway, and now to you here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, the Mojito is the perfect summer cocktail. Choose from the classic White Rum recipe or one of our exotic fruit flavored versions, Blueberry, Mango, Pomegranate, or Peach. Guaranteed to satisfy your taste buds

Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, You can enjoy the flavors of the Northwest shaken and strained in a Martini Shell. Vanilla Vodka, Hazelnut Liqueur , Kahlua and chilled double strength Coffee. Served up with a float of Fresh Whipped Cream. Almost too good to be true

First introduced to the United States at the 1964 World's Fair, Sangria is a fruity concoction of Fruit, Brandy and Wine. Jake's offers a red version made with cranberries and red wine as well as a refreshing basil peach sangria made with white wine
We puree Blueberries, Raspberries and Marionberries, add Vodka then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell. A cocktail with Anti-Oxidants
Italian Lemoncello Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice and Pomegranate Puree are hand shaken and topped with Sparkling Wine

Complex flavors, yet ultra refreshing. We muddle Fresh Basil, White Grapes and Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice. Then we add Vodka, Ginger Ale and Angostura Bitters. Shaken and served over ice. One taste and you'll see this cocktail lives up to its name

The West Coast's king of sour-style cocktails. Disputably invented at Henry Africa's in San Francisco, this drink strikes a perfect balance between vodka, orange liqueur, fresh lemon juice and a touch of sugar. Served up with a superfine sugar rim

name.en: Angry Orchard Apple Or Wyder's Dry Pear Hard Cider

description.en: There are many theories of origin regarding this incredibly popular cocktail. Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish we've been satisfying guests with our classic rendition for almost 40 years. Sauza Gold Tequila, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice , and a touch of sweetness are given a Jake's Famous shake and served on the rocks with salt

Recipes for this classic cocktail have been in print since the 1860s. Handcrafted with Bourbon, Fresh Squeezed Orange and Lemon Juice, a kiss of sweetness and garnished with an Orange and a Cherry. Sip a bit of history in our historic bar

The recipe for the Tom Collins first appeared in the 1876 edition of Jerry Thomas's "The Bartender's Guide". Enjoy our fresh juice version with your choice of Vodka, Gin (Tom Collins) or Bourbon (John Collins)

Originally made popular in cafes of Paris in the 1920s, this cocktail consists of Brandy, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon and Orange Juices then shaken to perfection and served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell...Santé
A contemporary classic, Vodka shaken with Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice and a splash of Cranberry

The King of all coffee cocktails. A proud mix of 151 Rum, Orange Liqueur and Kahlua is set on fire, dusted with Nutmeg and Cinnamon, filled with hot Coffee and extinguished with cold Whipped Cream. Enjoy the show!

We saved the best for last. Jake's Famous Crawfish made this classic a staple of the Portland cocktail scene before there was a Portland cocktail scene. We keep it traditional with Tullamore Dew Irish Whiskey, Steaming Hot Coffee, one Sugar Cube and a float of Bubbly Whipped Cream. This cocktail makes every day St. Patrick's Day!

An exotic blend of Sauza gold tequila, orange liqueur, mango puree, fresh squeezed orange & lime juice with muddled fresh jalapeno, and a dash of grenadine for color. Shaken Vigorously and served on the rocks with a salted rim

We transplanted this tasty cocktail from the heart of Savannah to Portland because it was so darn refreshing. We muddle fragrant mint leaves, fresh lemon juice and a dash of simple syrup. Add a generous pour of Absolut Apeach Vodka, fill with fresh brewed iced tea, then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served over ice
A delicious mix of Vodka, fresh squeezed lemon, orange, cherry puree with a touch of sweet. Hand shaken to perfection, over ice with a splash of club soda

With a colorful history that dates back to the pirates of the 1500's, its medicinal use in the 1800s, then to the exotic adventures of Ernest Hemmingway, and now to you here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, the Mojito is the perfect summer cocktail. Choose from the classic White Rum recipe or one of our exotic fruit flavored versions, Blueberry, Mango, Pomegranate, or Peach. Guaranteed to satisfy your taste buds

Amaro—literally bitter— is a traditional herbal liquore. Bitterness is an essential, revered delight to the Italian palate, and it holds a special place at the end of a meal. Each amaro follows its own unique, proprietary recipe that adheres to tradition and local ingredients. A laundry list of ingredients, often secret, is macerated in neutral spirit prior to distillation. Alcohol varies widely (typically from 15–40%), as does flavor, which ranges from bittersweet to sharply astringent
Bittersweet: a painless introduction
Not for the faint of heart
Bracingly bitter for the initiated

Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, You can enjoy the flavors of the Northwest shaken and strained in a Martini Shell. Vanilla Vodka, Hazelnut Liqueur , Kahlua and chilled double strength Coffee. Served up with a float of Fresh Whipped Cream. Almost too good to be true

First introduced to the United States at the 1964 World's Fair, Sangria is a fruity concoction of Fruit, Brandy and Wine. Jake's offers a red version made with cranberries and red wine as well as a refreshing basil peach sangria made with white wine
We puree Blueberries, Raspberries and Marionberries, add Vodka then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell. A cocktail with Anti-Oxidants
Italian Lemoncello Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice and Pomegranate Puree are hand shaken and topped with Sparkling Wine

Complex flavors, yet ultra refreshing. We muddle Fresh Basil, White Grapes and Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice. Then we add Vodka, Ginger Ale and Angostura Bitters. Shaken and served over ice. One taste and you'll see this cocktail lives up to its name

The West Coast's king of sour-style cocktails. Disputably invented at Henry Africa's in San Francisco, this drink strikes a perfect balance between vodka, orange liqueur, fresh lemon juice and a touch of sugar. Served up with a superfine sugar rim

name.en: Angry Orchard Apple Or Wyder's Dry Pear Hard Cider

description.en: There are many theories of origin regarding this incredibly popular cocktail. Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish we've been satisfying guests with our classic rendition for almost 40 years. Sauza Gold Tequila, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice , and a touch of sweetness are given a Jake's Famous shake and served on the rocks with salt

Recipes for this classic cocktail have been in print since the 1860s. Handcrafted with Bourbon, Fresh Squeezed Orange and Lemon Juice, a kiss of sweetness and garnished with an Orange and a Cherry. Sip a bit of history in our historic bar

The recipe for the Tom Collins first appeared in the 1876 edition of Jerry Thomas's "The Bartender's Guide". Enjoy our fresh juice version with your choice of Vodka, Gin (Tom Collins) or Bourbon (John Collins)

Originally made popular in cafes of Paris in the 1920s, this cocktail consists of Brandy, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon and Orange Juices then shaken to perfection and served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell...Santé
A contemporary classic, Vodka shaken with Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice and a splash of Cranberry

The King of all coffee cocktails. A proud mix of 151 Rum, Orange Liqueur and Kahlua is set on fire, dusted with Nutmeg and Cinnamon, filled with hot Coffee and extinguished with cold Whipped Cream. Enjoy the show!

We saved the best for last. Jake's Famous Crawfish made this classic a staple of the Portland cocktail scene before there was a Portland cocktail scene. We keep it traditional with Tullamore Dew Irish Whiskey, Steaming Hot Coffee, one Sugar Cube and a float of Bubbly Whipped Cream. This cocktail makes every day St. Patrick's Day!

An exotic blend of Sauza gold tequila, orange liqueur, mango puree, fresh squeezed orange & lime juice with muddled fresh jalapeno, and a dash of grenadine for color. Shaken Vigorously and served on the rocks with a salted rim

We transplanted this tasty cocktail from the heart of Savannah to Portland because it was so darn refreshing. We muddle fragrant mint leaves, fresh lemon juice and a dash of simple syrup. Add a generous pour of Absolut Apeach Vodka, fill with fresh brewed iced tea, then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served over ice
A delicious mix of Vodka, fresh squeezed lemon, orange, cherry puree with a touch of sweet. Hand shaken to perfection, over ice with a splash of club soda

With a colorful history that dates back to the pirates of the 1500's, its medicinal use in the 1800s, then to the exotic adventures of Ernest Hemmingway, and now to you here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, the Mojito is the perfect summer cocktail. Amaro—literally bitter— is a traditional herbal liquore. Bitterness is an essential, revered delight to the Italian palate, and it holds a special place at the end of a meal. Each amaro follows its own unique, proprietary recipe that adheres to tradition and local ingredients. A laundry list of ingredients, often secret, is macerated in neutral spirit prior to distillation. Alcohol varies widely (typically from 15–40%), as does flavor, which ranges from bittersweet to sharply astringent
Bittersweet: a painless introduction
Not for the faint of heart
Bracingly bitter for the initiated

Amaro—literally bitter— is a traditional herbal liquore. Bitterness is an essential, revered delight to the Italian palate, and it holds a special place at the end of a meal. Each amaro follows its own unique, proprietary recipe that adheres to tradition and local ingredients. A laundry list of ingredients, often secret, is macerated in neutral spirit prior to distillation. Alcohol varies widely (typically from 15–40%), as does flavor, which ranges from bittersweet to sharply astringent
Bittersweet: a painless introduction
Not for the faint of heart
Bracingly bitter for the initiated

Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, You can enjoy the flavors of the Northwest shaken and strained in a Martini Shell. Vanilla Vodka, Hazelnut Liqueur , Kahlua and chilled double strength Coffee. Served up with a float of Fresh Whipped Cream. Almost too good to be true

First introduced to the United States at the 1964 World's Fair, Sangria is a fruity concoction of Fruit, Brandy and Wine. Jake's offers a red version made with cranberries and red wine as well as a refreshing basil peach sangria made with white wine
We puree Blueberries, Raspberries and Marionberries, add Vodka then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell. A cocktail with Anti-Oxidants
Italian Lemoncello Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice and Pomegranate Puree are hand shaken and topped with Sparkling Wine

Complex flavors, yet ultra refreshing. We muddle Fresh Basil, White Grapes and Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice. Then we add Vodka, Ginger Ale and Angostura Bitters. Shaken and served over ice. One taste and you'll see this cocktail lives up to its name

The West Coast's king of sour-style cocktails. Disputably invented at Henry Africa's in San Francisco, this drink strikes a perfect balance between vodka, orange liqueur, fresh lemon juice and a touch of sugar. Served up with a superfine sugar rim

name.en: Angry Orchard Apple Or Wyder's Dry Pear Hard Cider

description.en: There are many theories of origin regarding this incredibly popular cocktail. Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish we've been satisfying guests with our classic rendition for almost 40 years. Sauza Gold Tequila, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice , and a touch of sweetness are given a Jake's Famous shake and served on the rocks with salt

Recipes for this classic cocktail have been in print since the 1860s. Handcrafted with Bourbon, Fresh Squeezed Orange and Lemon Juice, a kiss of sweetness and garnished with an Orange and a Cherry. Sip a bit of history in our historic bar

The recipe for the Tom Collins first appeared in the 1876 edition of Jerry Thomas's "The Bartender's Guide". Enjoy our fresh juice version with your choice of Vodka, Gin (Tom Collins) or Bourbon (John Collins)

Originally made popular in cafes of Paris in the 1920s, this cocktail consists of Brandy, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon and Orange Juices then shaken to perfection and served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell...Santé
A contemporary classic, Vodka shaken with Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice and a splash of Cranberry

The King of all coffee cocktails. A proud mix of 151 Rum, Orange Liqueur and Kahlua is set on fire, dusted with Nutmeg and Cinnamon, filled with hot Coffee and extinguished with cold Whipped Cream. Enjoy the show!

We saved the best for last. Jake's Famous Crawfish made this classic a staple of the Portland cocktail scene before there was a Portland cocktail scene. We keep it traditional with Tullamore Dew Irish Whiskey, Steaming Hot Coffee, one Sugar Cube and a float of Bubbly Whipped Cream. This cocktail makes every day St. Patrick's Day!

An exotic blend of Sauza gold tequila, orange liqueur, mango puree, fresh squeezed orange & lime juice with muddled fresh jalapeno, and a dash of grenadine for color. Shaken Vigorously and served on the rocks with a salted rim

We transplanted this tasty cocktail from the heart of Savannah to Portland because it was so darn refreshing. We muddle fragrant mint leaves, fresh lemon juice and a dash of simple syrup. Add a generous pour of Absolut Apeach Vodka, fill with fresh brewed iced tea, then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served over ice
A delicious mix of Vodka, fresh squeezed lemon, orange, cherry puree with a touch of sweet. Hand shaken to perfection, over ice with a splash of club soda

With a colorful history that dates back to the pirates of the 1500's, its medicinal use in the 1800s, then to the exotic adventures of Ernest Hemmingway, and now to you here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, the Mojito is the perfect summer cocktail. Choose from the classic White Rum recipe or one of our exotic fruit flavored versions, Blueberry, Mango, Pomegranate, or Peach. Guaranteed to satisfy your taste buds

Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, You can enjoy the flavors of the Northwest shaken and strained in a Martini Shell. Vanilla Vodka, Hazelnut Liqueur , Kahlua and chilled double strength Coffee. Served up with a float of Fresh Whipped Cream. Almost too good to be true

First introduced to the United States at the 1964 World's Fair, Sangria is a fruity concoction of Fruit, Brandy and Wine. Jake's offers a red version made with cranberries and red wine as well as a refreshing basil peach sangria made with white wine
We puree Blueberries, Raspberries and Marionberries, add Vodka then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell. A cocktail with Anti-Oxidants
Italian Lemoncello Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice and Pomegranate Puree are hand shaken and topped with Sparkling Wine

Complex flavors, yet ultra refreshing. We muddle Fresh Basil, White Grapes and Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice. Then we add Vodka, Ginger Ale and Angostura Bitters. Shaken and served over ice. One taste and you'll see this cocktail lives up to its name

The West Coast's king of sour-style cocktails. Disputably invented at Henry Africa's in San Francisco, this drink strikes a perfect balance between vodka, orange liqueur, fresh lemon juice and a touch of sugar. Served up with a superfine sugar rim

name.en: Angry Orchard Apple Or Wyder's Dry Pear Hard Cider

description.en: There are many theories of origin regarding this incredibly popular cocktail. Here at Jake's Famous Crawfish we've been satisfying guests with our classic rendition for almost 40 years. Sauza Gold Tequila, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice , and a touch of sweetness are given a Jake's Famous shake and served on the rocks with salt

Recipes for this classic cocktail have been in print since the 1860s. Handcrafted with Bourbon, Fresh Squeezed Orange and Lemon Juice, a kiss of sweetness and garnished with an Orange and a Cherry. Sip a bit of history in our historic bar

The recipe for the Tom Collins first appeared in the 1876 edition of Jerry Thomas's "The Bartender's Guide". Enjoy our fresh juice version with your choice of Vodka, Gin (Tom Collins) or Bourbon (John Collins)

Originally made popular in cafes of Paris in the 1920s, this cocktail consists of Brandy, Orange Liqueur, Fresh Squeezed Lemon and Orange Juices then shaken to perfection and served in a Sugar Rimmed Martini Shell...Santé
A contemporary classic, Vodka shaken with Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice and a splash of Cranberry

The King of all coffee cocktails. A proud mix of 151 Rum, Orange Liqueur and Kahlua is set on fire, dusted with Nutmeg and Cinnamon, filled with hot Coffee and extinguished with cold Whipped Cream. Enjoy the show!

We saved the best for last. Jake's Famous Crawfish made this classic a staple of the Portland cocktail scene before there was a Portland cocktail scene. We keep it traditional with Tullamore Dew Irish Whiskey, Steaming Hot Coffee, one Sugar Cube and a float of Bubbly Whipped Cream. This cocktail makes every day St. Patrick's Day!

An exotic blend of Sauza gold tequila, orange liqueur, mango puree, fresh squeezed orange & lime juice with muddled fresh jalapeno, and a dash of grenadine for color. Shaken Vigorously and served on the rocks with a salted rim

We transplanted this tasty cocktail from the heart of Savannah to Portland because it was so darn refreshing. We muddle fragrant mint leaves, fresh lemon juice and a dash of simple syrup. Add a generous pour of Absolut Apeach Vodka, fill with fresh brewed iced tea, then give it a Jake's Famous shake. Served over ice
A delicious mix of Vodka, fresh squeezed lemon, orange, cherry puree with a touch of sweet. Hand shaken to perfection, over ice with a splash of club soda

With a colorful history that dates back to the pirates of the 1500's, its medicinal use in the 1800s, then to the exotic adventures of Ernest Hemmingway, and now to you here at Jake's Famous Crawfish, the Mojito is the perfect summer cocktail. Choose from the classic White Rum recipe or one of our exotic fruit flavored versions, Blueberry, Mango, Pomegranate, or Peach. Guaranteed to satisfy your taste buds

Amaro—literally bitter— is a traditional herbal liquore. Bitterness is an essential, revered delight to the Italian palate, and it holds a special place at the end of a meal. Each amaro follows its own unique, proprietary recipe that adheres to tradition and local ingredients. A laundry list of ingredients, often secret, is macerated in neutral spirit prior to distillation. Alcohol varies widely (typically from 15–40%), as does flavor, which ranges from bittersweet to sharply astringent
Bittersweet: a painless introduction
Not for the faint of heart
Bracingly bitter for the initiated
